Description: Lower body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekythos; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of warriors and horseman (lower body of warrior with added red, to left; lower legs of horse, to right; foot of second, possibly kneeling warrior, to left, remaining); below, narrow black band above black zone on tapering lower body of vessel.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Classical Archaeology, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Venit attributes the vessel to the Class of Athens 581 i or ii.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 321-2, no. B354)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0810) (Phase 1)
